frameDefinitions: A Cognizer retains facts in memory and is able to retrieve them.
A Cognizer calls up an episodic memory of past Experience or an Impression of a Salient_entity formed  on the basis of past experience.
A Speaker reveals Information that was previously secret to an Addressee.
A Communicator or Medium briefly references something in a Message, in which only a subpart of the full content is profiled.
An Entity is presented as having been seen or experienced by a (typically generic and backgrounded)
This frame contains verbs and nouns that communicate the act of a Speaker to address a Message to some Addressee using language.
frameExamples: I was impressed that she 'd actually <t>remembered</t> Radish 's name (= what Radish's name is)
Kozmo could <t>remember</t> when his modem was the fastest he could buy.
Could it be true that Martin himself was the one who <t>spilled</t> the <t>beans</t> on Pops and Brad's planned wedding?
The General Secretary <t>mentions</t> some of them in his report.
Susanna Fulton's work is <t>new</t> to me.
I now <t>declare</t> you members of this Society.
listRoleDefinitions: The person who retains and retrieves information.
<fen>Mental_content</fen> stored by and accessible to the <fen>Cognizer</fen>. It may derive from experience or activity or simply from being informed of it.
The time when the <fen>Cognizer</fen> retrieves <fen>Mental_content</fen> or forgets it.
A person who recalls memories of past experience or impressions.
A person or thing that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> remembers as being involved in some state or event or as having some property.
A past event or state that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> witnessed and is now recalling. The <fen>Experience</fen> may be a specific event or state or a vaguer period that is treated as a unit.

A property that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> attributes to the <fen>Salient_entity</fen> based on their past experience of the <fen>Salient_entity</fen> or a category to which the <fen>Salient_entity</fen> is assigned.
A property or role that a <fen>Salient_entity</fen> actually held and which frames the memories that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> has of the <fen>Salient_entity</fen>.
The time when the <fen>Cognizer</fen> remembers the experience.
The <fen>Speaker</fen> is the sentient entity that reveals  the <fen>Information</fen> (whether spoken or written).
<fen>Information</fen> identifies the content that the <fen>Speaker</fen> reveals to the <fen>Addressee</fen>.  It can be expressed as a clause or as a noun phrase.
The <fen>Topic</fen> is the subject matter about which the <fen>Speaker</fen> is speaking. It normally only appears with noun targets, or in special constructions.
<fen>Medium</fen> is the physical entity or channel used by the <fen>Speaker</fen> to transmit the statement.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the revelation is made.
The role specifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Information</fen> is revealed.
The person who uses language in the written or spoken modality to convey a <fen>Message</fen> to another person.
A proposition or set of propositions that the <fen>Communicator</fen> wants the <fen>Addressee</fen> to believe or take for granted.
The physical or abstract setting in which the <fen>Message</fen> is conveyed.
The relevant entity or state-of-affairs that the <fen>Communicator</fen> mentions.
When the the <fen>Message</fen> is mentioned.
The location where the <fen>Communicator</fen> communicates the <fen>Message</fen>.
A concrete thing or abstract phenomenon or fact that is assessed in terms of how well recognizable it is to a <fen>Cognizer</fen>.
The (typically non-specific and backgrounded) sentient being for whom the <fen>Entity</fen> possesses a specified level of recognizability.
The deviation of the actual level of recognizability of the <fen>Entity</fen> from the level specified by the target.

The <fen>Speaker</fen> is the sentient entity that produces the <fen>Message</fen> (whether spoken or written).  It is normally expressed as the External Argument of predicative uses of the <t>target	</t> word, or as the Genitive modifier of the noun.
The <fen>Message</fen> is the role that identifies the content of what the <fen>Speaker</fen> is communicating to the <fen>Addressee</fen>.  It can be expressed as a clause or as a noun phrase.
The <fen>Topic</fen> is the subject matter to which the <fen>Message</fen> pertains. It is normally expressed as a PP Complement headed by 'about', but in some cases it can appear as a direct object.
<fen>Medium</fen> is the physical entity or channel used by the <fen>Speaker</fen> to transmit the statement.
The <fen>Time</fen> at which the <fen>Message</fen> is made.
The role specifies the location where the <fen>Message</fen> takes place.
listRoleExamples: I bet <fex>Johno</fex> can remember the name of the Ramones' drummer.
Do you remember <fex>how to spell cupboard ?</fex>
<fex>Afterwards</fex>, I forgot what I was pissed off about, but I was.
I will truly miss Delmar and <fex>I</fex> will always remember when his eyes lit up everytime he got ice-cream.
today I saw a sister's exclassmate, and didn't recognise him, I remember <fex>him</fex> taller.
I can still remember <fex>saying the pledge every morning before class in elementary school</fex>, a rare occurrence among elementary school kids nowadays.
I remember Peter <fex>as immensely kind in those first three weeks before I was packed off to boarding school</fex>.
Atulprasad is principally remembered <fex>as a musician and composer</fex>.
I 'll <fex>never</fex> forget being in hospital
<fex>Kornfeldt</fex> revealed that he had embezzled more than twice the amount his company owned.
You shouldn't reveal <fex>any murders you've been involved in</fex>, if you know what I mean.
Revelations <fex>about the coming of the Christ</fex> surfaced in early Mediaeval times.
Kim confided in me <fex>over the phone</fex>.
According to the report, he confessed to eating onions and gargling with generic mouthwash <fex>at the station</fex>.
<fex>Her father</fex> never mentioned it.
A CBS report did mention <fex>that the First Lady was required to wear a flak jacket for her safety</fex>.
<fex>The report</fex> also mentioned contamination problems during the manufacture.
If someone mentions <fex>things like ration books</fex> , my stomach turns.
He gave <fex>an address</fex> quite familiar to the chauffeur.
The information used to illustrate the concept is familiar <fex>to the reader</fex>.
He gave an address <fex>quite</fex> familiar to the chauffeur.
<fex>Evelyn</fex> spoke feelingly about what happened.
Evelyn said <fex>that she was not ready to leave</fex>.
Evelyn spoke candidly <fex>about her past</fex>.
Kim preached to me <fex>over the phone</fex>.
In some remarks <fex>at the National Press Club</fex>, Mr. Keating said he would make a better prime minister tha nMr. Hawke.
